item.title: Material Design Lite theme for hugo
item.author: s@muel.be (Samuel Debruyn)
item.description:
As I wanted to learn more about hugo while developing this blog, I created a new theme for hugo. It is mostly plain HTML, CSS and JavaScript, but it also contains some Go Templating.

The theme is based on the blog template from Google’s Material Design Lite.

The source code is available on GitHub and I host a demo on GitHub Pages.

item.title: SamShack
item.author: s@muel.be (Samuel Debruyn)
item.description:
In January 2014 I had to develop a webshop in PHP for a school project. At the time we just learnt about MVC and the best framework for the job seemed CakePHP. My webshop had responsive design and was very fast (high scores on PageSpeed and Yahoo YSlow).

The webshop itself is no longer available online, but the source code is available on GitHub.

Functional requirements

Configuration panel

  • CRUD actions for every kind of data
  • The administrator has to log in to be able to do anything
  • The administrator must be able to create other administrative user accounts
  • The administrator can view the ERD of the webshop

Client site

  • Products have categories and can be sorted and filtered by category
  • Shopping cart which can be modified at any time
  • Shoppers have to create user accounts to buy anything
  • Only registered users can view the stock
  • The stock needs to automatically updated after a sale
  • Confirmation emails for all kinds of actions
  • Password reset mails
  • History of purchases
  • Personalized recommendations

item.title: B&B Go Eun API
item.author: s@muel.be (Samuel Debruyn)
item.description:
This API was made for the Android app B&B Go Eun.

It is written in PHP and built on top of CakePHP. The API returns all results in JSON and is follows most the RESTful API design principles. It relies on a MySQL database for all of its data.

Since the assignment was graded in June 2014, it’s possible that the API is no longer available. The source code is available on GitHub.

item.title: B&B Go Eun app
item.author: s@muel.be (Samuel Debruyn)
item.description:
This Android app was a school project I made with another student. We established several goals:

Technical requirements:

  • We had to learn a lot about PHP and Android development.
  • The app had to connect with a (RESTful) API.
  • The API had to connect with a database.
  • The app had to be very simple so we could demonstrate the main goals (connection with API).
  • We had to made sure that everything worked fine and all known bugs were fixed.
  • We had to write a few pages of documentation for our lecturer.

Functional requirements:

  • Show information about available rooms
  • Show contact information with links that open the diailer app, the email app, Google Maps…
  • Show promotions coupled to rooms
  • Show the breakfast menu
  • Show nearby points of interest in a predefined range, sorted by distance

The assignment included finding a real client and the client we chose was a friend who owns a B&B on AirBnB.

Since the assignment was graded in June 2014, it’s possible that the app is no longer available. The source code is available on GitHub.

item.title: Go for Change
item.author: s@muel.be (Samuel Debruyn)
item.description:
Go For Change is an Android app I wrote for a school project. It was actually part of another student’s internship, but since that student quit his internship, the client asked my lecturers if they knew another student who could finish the job. All I had was 2 weeks so I didn’t write any documentation and the code is quite messy.

The application contains a questionnaire targeted to small business owners. The difficult part was the order of the questions. Some questions only had to be answered depending on the answers of previous questions and the client had to be able to change the questions, the possible answers and the order of the questions. I created a small SQLite database and a method to export the answered questions to a CSV file.

This application is only visible in the Play Store for test users. The source is available on GitHub.

Since the assignment was graded in June 2014, it’s possible that the app is no longer available.

item.title: Rood Fluweel Bali
item.author: s@muel.be (Samuel Debruyn)
item.description:
Rood Fluweel Bali is a Windows Store app, designed for Windows 8.1 desktops and tablets. I made this app for Comm-IT as part of a summer job.

Rood Fluweel is a SaaS made on top of ASP.NET. It can manage ticketing, reservations, payments etc.

The goal of the Windows Store app is to make it easier to print and create tickets when a lot of people are coming through the entrance at once.
